required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of CD-008-0045 in Patients With Generalized Anxiety Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo- and Active- Controlled Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of CD-008-0045 in Patients With Generalized Anxiety Disorder

lead_sponsor.agency: ChemRar Research and Development Institute, LLC

clinical_study.source: ChemRar Research and Development Institute, LLC

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo- and active-controlled study to assess the efficacy and safety of CD-008-0045 in patients with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). Each patient will participate in the study for the period of approximately 37 weeks: Screening and Run-in period: 1 week; Study Treatment period: 32 weeks; Follow-up period: 4 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock: The study drug CD-008-0045 has a multi-targeted activity, i.e., able to inhibit adrenergic, dopamine, serotonin, and histamine receptors, thus allowing to assume its wide therapeutic potential. At Screening, the patients who meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria will be included into one-week single-blind Placebo Run-in period. At Week 0 the patients will be start double-blind Placebo and active comparator treatment period. The patients will be randomized to receive CD-008-0045 40 mg daily or Placebo or Afobazol (fabomotizole) for 8 weeks. After that, there will be an open-label treatment period for 26 weeks. The potential withdrawal syndrome will be assessed during four-week Follow-up Period.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo- and active-controlled study to assess the efficacy and safety of CD-008-0045 in patients with GAD. The primary study objective is To assess the efficacy of CD-008-0045 at a dose 20 mg BID vs Placebo and Afobazol based on the change of the total score of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (SIGH-A) structured interview at Week 8 from baseline. Treatment response is considered the difference between group CD-008-0045 and Placebo is 5.5 points decrease of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS) total score from baseline.
study_design_info.masking_description: Double (Participant, Investigator) Dose blinding will be performed using Placebo. Patient will receive 2 vials labeled for study drug administration as follows: 1 capsule in the morning, and evening. Package numbers were assigned via IWRS. Thus, during the Study Treatment period, neither the patient nor the Investigator knew the group to which the patient was allocated. Single blinding was performed during the Placebo Run-in and Follow-up periods.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in total score of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) at Week 8 from baseline.
primary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) score [the values from 0 to 56; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: The frequency of decrease in total score of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) by 50% or more at week 8 from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients who demonstrate ≥ 50% decrease of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) [the values from 0 to 56; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] total score from baseline [% of patients]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total score and sum of scores of the subscales for assessment of the mental and somatic anxiety of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (SIGH-A) structured interview for each parameter at Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the score sum of the mental and somatic anxiety subscales of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) [the values from 0 to 24 (the mental subscale) and from 0 to 32 (the somatic subscale); the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of score of items 1 (Anxious mood) and 2 (Tension) of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) from baseline at Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the score in items 1 (Anxious mood) and 2 (Tension) of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) [the values from 0 to 4; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who reached a medically induced remission (the sum of scores of the SIGH-A ≤ 7) at Week 8 and Week32
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with the sum of scores of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) ≤ 7 at Week 8 and Week32

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the sum of scores of the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) at Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32 from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) [the values from 0 to 54; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Clinical Global Impression-Severity (CGI-S) at Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32 from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time Frame: Baseline to Week 2, Week 2 to Week 4, Week 4 to Week 8, Week 8 to Week 16, Week 16 to Week 24, Week 24 to Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Clinical Global Impression-Severity (CGI-S) score [the values from 1 to 7; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) at Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) score [the values from 1 to 7; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of daytime somnolence level based on Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) [the values from 0 to 10; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total score of the Visual Analog Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) at Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32 from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Visual Analog Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) score [the values from 0 to 10; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in results of the Trail Making Test (TMT) at Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32 from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 4, Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Trail Making Test (TMT) results

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total score of the Quality of Life Scale (SF-20) at Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32 from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 8, Week 16, Week 24 and Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Quality of Life Scale (SF-20) [the values from 0 to 78; the higher scores mean a better outcome]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total score of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) at Week 4 after the last dose of therapy and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Weeks 4 after the last dose of therapy. The last dose of therapy to 4 Weeks after that
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale structured interview (SIGH-A) [the values from 0 to 56; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total score of the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) at Week 4 after the last dose of therapy and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Weeks 4 after the last dose of therapy. The last dose of therapy to 4 Weeks after that
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) [the values from 0 to 54; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Clinical Global Impression-Severity (CGI-S) score at Week 4 after the last dose of therapy and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Weeks 4 after the last dose of therapy. The last dose of therapy to 4 Weeks after that
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Clinical Global Impression-Severity (CGI-S) [the values from 1 to 7; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total score of the Visual Analog Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) at Weeks 4 after the last dose of therapy and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Weeks 4 after the last dose of therapy. The last dose of therapy to 4 Weeks after that
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Visual Analog Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) [the values from 0 to 10; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) at Weeks 4 after the last dose of therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The last dose of therapy to 4 Weeks after that
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change of the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) [the values from 1 to 7; the higher scores mean a worse outcome] score [score]

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of CD-008-0045 and its metabolite М1 1 hour after first dose of the study drug and before next doses at visits (Ctrough)
secondary_outcome.description: Ctrough of CD-008-0045 [ng/ml], Ctrough of M1 [ng/ml]

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of CYP2D6 polymorphism on the pharmacokinetic values of the study drug
secondary_outcome.description: CYP2D6 polymorphism [type of metabolism], Ctrough of CD-008-0045 [ng/ml], Ctrough of M1 [ng/ml]

arm_group.description: Patients assigned to the CD-008-0045 40 mg/day group will receive 1 capsule of CD-008-0045 (20 mg) before breakfast and before dinner for 32 weeks.
Patients assigned to the Placebo group will receive 1 placebo capsule before breakfast, and dinner for 8 weeks.
Patients assigned to the Afobazol 30 mg/day group will receive 1 tablet of Afobazol (10 mg) before breakfast, before lunch and before dinner for 8 weeks.

overall_official.affiliation: "Research Center for Mental Health" Scientific Institution
